section.title: Requirements
section.para: Before we can get started, you have to make sure that some requirements are met by your development environment. You will need:

listitem.para: POSIX-like operating system (Pustefix has been tested with Linux and Mac OS X, but might also work with other systems like *BSD)

section.para: The installation of these tools is not covered by this tutorial. Please refer to the documentation provided with these tools for installation instructions.

section.title: Prepare the project directory
section.para: If you are not using Eclipse, you can just create an empty directory that will contain the project files and proceed with .

Start the Eclipse workbench and create a new project of type Java Project". Make sure that you choose separate source and build folders: Use src for the source and build for the build folder. This is important because the Pustefix build script expects these folders.

section.title: Add Pustefix repository to your Maven configuration
section.para: In order to be able to resolve the dependencies, you should add the Pustefix repository to your list of Maven repositories in your ~/.m2/settings.xml.

section.title: Configure Eclipse
section.para: You can generate an Eclipse configuration for your project using "mvn eclipse:eclipse". After generating the configuration you can import your project to the Eclipse workspace using the import wizard in the Eclipse workbench.
